page.title: 19ENVIRONMENT
page.content: Driving into the Garrison one does not have the impression of being in a very Military area.The 5,000 acre camp area has been imaginatively landscaped open plan green areas giving the atmosphere of pleasant rural scenery.Trees are everywhere woods,copse and small groups.It is good to see many small groups of young Oaks.There is a well planned Woodland Walk. We have a great range of moorland. Several streams, springs and a pond are in our area. Wildlife abounds,many of the creatures are not so timid of man.A great variety of birds can be seen Magpies, Heron,Hawks, seabirds, and the usual garden country -side dwellers. Grey squirrels,rabbits and deer often give one a second look before moving off.
